6 September, 1919

Mr. S. S. Kwan 
566 Commonwealth Avenue

Boston, Mass.

My dear Kwan:

I have just returned to Andover and to my 
work at the office. On my desk I find your letter 
of August 22nd. Needless to say I hasten to send 
you this brief word of sympathy and good-will and 
to express the sincere hope that Miss Lee, if forced 
to undergo the operation referred to, has now com -
pletely recovered from the effects. Please give her 
my best regards and best wishes, too.

I have just regå over Mr. Sawyer's recom -
mendation in the way of surgeons, and am glad to note

that the three names are probably the very best men 
in Boston.

Be sure to run out to see me before you 
start back to China. Sehool opens on the lötk, and 
I shall be deep in work from now on. Even so, I am 
anxious to have a parting word with you before you 
start for home.

Hastily, but sincerely yours,
